Dogs should not be allowed on buses at all. Unless they are guide dogs.

Recently there has been a lot on the news, about how dogs have lashed out on adults and children.

How can bus drivers tell if dogs are vicous or not?
Smoking and drinking alcohol has been banned as they create problems for innocent people. So dogs should be too.

Dogs that are on the bus sit on the chairs, which is frankly quite unhygienic.

 The bus fair is currently £2.40, why should people pay that if there is a dog on the bus? Especially if it could put adults and children at risk.
